item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Saturday, April 26, 2025 at 12:30 PM UTC
item.description:
1. The Friendship Recession: The Lost Art of Connecting (71 points | 17 comments)
2. An end to all this prostate trouble? (118 points | 51 comments)
3. Cloth (254 points | 27 comments)
4. Mark Zuckerberg personally lost the Facebook antitrust case (150 points | 33 comments)
5. Berkeley Humanoid Lite – Open-source robot (167 points | 16 comments)
6. Backblaze: Mounting Losses, Lawsuits, Sham Accounting, Insider Selling (40 points | 4 comments)
7. Freshpaint (YC S19) is hiring back end and front end engineers (Remote, US only) ( | hide)
8. Lossless LLM compression for efficient GPU inference via dynamic-length float (360 points | 108 comments)
9. Wikipedia’s nonprofit status questioned by D.C. U.S. attorney (633 points | 531 comments)
10. Mike Lindell's lawyers used AI to write brief–judge finds nearly 30 mistakes (60 points | 29 comments)
11. Writing "/etc/hosts" breaks the Substack editor (572 points | 310 comments)
12. Commodore OS 3.0 Released (20 points | discuss)
13. Parallel ./configure (133 points | 110 comments)
14. I wrote a book called "Crap Towns". It seemed funny at the time (283 points | 202 comments)
15. World Emulation via Neural Network (192 points | 35 comments)
16. First and 2nd gen Nest Thermostats will lose support in Oct 2025 (21 points | 2 comments)
17. Mobygratis – Free Moby music to empower your creative projects (47 points | 12 comments)
18. Show HN: Formalizing Principia Mathematica using Lean (149 points | 29 comments)
19. Show HN: Empty Enter Expander – Type less in the terminal with this tool (38 points | 16 comments)
20. Eurorack Knob Idea (288 points | 106 comments)
21. Reproducibility project fails to validate dozens of biomedical studies (208 points | 97 comments)
22. Colossal Cave Adventure (1976) (40 points | 16 comments)
23. A $20k American-made electric pickup with no paint, no stereo, no screen (1229 points | 1071 comments)
24. Apparently Bluesky has one centralized service, the "relay" (71 points | 40 comments)
25. I designed my LED matrix PCB with code (92 points | 40 comments)
26. GCC 15.1 (256 points | 134 comments)
27. Avoiding skill atrophy in the age of AI (236 points | 251 comments)
28. Curry: A functional logic programming language (146 points | 32 comments)
29. Amazon Japan ordered to pay 35M. yen for allowing listing of fakes (106 points | 20 comments)
30. Show HN: Magnitude – open-source, AI-native test framework for web apps (160 points | 39 comments)
